cards.title: The Sculpted / What a young girl is thinking when she undergoes FGM
cards.rawTitle: What a young girl is thinking when she undergoes FGM

item.title: The Sculpted: what a young girl is thinking when she undergoes FGM
item.trailText: This short film deals with the intimate thoughts of a young girl about to undergo female genital mutilation (FGM)
item.standFirst: This short film deals with the intimate thoughts of a young girl about to undergo female genital mutilation (FGM). It follows the internal monologue of a girl who never actually speaks, and uses creative imagery to illustrate the cruelty of the cut. It was made by student film-makers Ellie Jones and Miholyn Soon, from Westminster University, in support of the worldwide campaign to end FGM within a generation. It was screened at the Campus MovieFest in Hollywood

stillImage.caption: 620x372 trailpic for Students film on FGM wins prize at film festival in Hollywood Photograph: guardian.co.uk

item.title: The balloon animal zoo
item.trailText: For a decade, Sarah DeRemer worked for a vet. Now, she has turned her hand to doctoring rubber animals, using photo-manipulation to make them as life-like as possible. Inflatable animals never looked so good ...
item.standFirst: For a decade, Sarah DeRemer worked for a vet. Now, she has turned her hand to doctoring rubber animals, using photo-manipulation to make them as life-like as possible. Inflatable animals never looked so good ...

cards.title: Life in the Arctic village of Shishmaref
cards.rawTitle: Life in the Arctic village of Shishmaref

item.title: Life in the Arctic village of Shishmaref
item.trailText: Located on the island of Sarichef, in the far north-west corner of Alaska, the village sits beside the Chukchi Sea where Shell has been given approval to begin drilling
item.standFirst: Located on the island of Sarichef, in the far north-west corner of Alaska, the village sits beside the Chukchi Sea where Shell has been given approval to begin drilling. The community, mostly made up of Inupiat Inuit, is concerned about the plans, which add to the daily problems they already face as a result of climate change

displayImages.caption: The village of Shishmaref is threatened by rising temperatures, which cause a reduction in sea ice. This allows higher storm surges to reach the shore, while thawing permafrost makes the shoreline more vulnerable to erosion Photograph: Andrew Burton/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: The village of Shishmaref is threatened due to rising temperatures. These cause a reduction in sea ice which allows higher storm surges to reach the shore while thawing permafrost makes the shoreline more vulnerable to erosion.
displayImages.cleanCaption: The village of Shishmaref is threatened by rising temperatures, which cause a reduction in sea ice. This allows higher storm surges to reach the shore, while thawing permafrost makes the shoreline more vulnerable to erosion

cards.title: Car filmed driving backwards for several miles through heavy LA traffic
cards.rawTitle: Car filmed driving backwards for several miles through heavy LA traffic

item.title: Car filmed driving backwards for several miles through heavy LA traffic
item.trailText: A car is driven backwards for several miles through heavy traffic down a major Los Angeles thoroughfare
item.standFirst: A car is driven backwards for several miles through heavy traffic down a major Los Angeles thoroughfare. LA police are looking into who was driving the brand new Audi with no license plates. Kevin Zanazanian recorded the video on his cellphone, and told local TV stations there were two people in the car – a man behind the wheel and a woman in the passenger seat

cards.title: Greece crisis / Anti-austerity protesters demonstrate against terms of bailout
cards.rawTitle: Anti-austerity protesters demonstrate against terms of bailout

item.title: Greece crisis: anti-austerity protesters demonstrate against terms of bailout
item.trailText: Anti-austerity protesters gather at Syntagma square in front of the Greek parliament on Monday
item.standFirst: Anti-austerity protesters gather at Syntagma square in front of the Greek parliament on Monday. Demonstrators are opposing the terms of a bailout deal accepted by Greek prime minister Alexis Tsipras after weeks of negotiations. This is the country's third bailout programme and it will bring further austerity to the debt-stricken nation. Athens has also agreed to sell off state assets worth €50bn

cards.title: Duke of York gives Patrick Stewart the Vulcan salute - video
cards.rawTitle: Duke of York gives Patrick Stewart the Vulcan salute

item.title: Duke of York gives Patrick Stewart the Vulcan salute
item.trailText: Live long and prosper is the advice the Duke of York gives Patrick Stewart on Monday, after he replaces the actor as chancellor of Huddersfield University
item.standFirst:
Live long and prosper is the advice the Duke of York gives Patrick Stewart on Monday, after he replaces the actor as chancellor of Huddersfield University. Prince Andrew thanks Patrick Stewart, best known for his role in Star Trek as Captain Jean-Luc Picard, for all his services before giving the famous hand salute, leading the crowd to erupt in laughs and claps. Both men also received an honorary doctorate

• To view the full video click here

cards.title: Trailer watch / Oscar Isaac stars in David Simon's HBO drama Show Me a Hero
cards.rawTitle: Oscar Isaac stars in David Simon's HBO drama Show Me a Hero

item.title: Trailer watch: Oscar Isaac stars in David Simon's HBO drama Show Me a Hero
item.trailText: The six-part miniseries about a New York mayor in the 1970s is from David Simon, creator of The Wire, and is directed by Paul Haggis
item.standFirst: The six-part miniseries about a New York mayor in the 1970s is from David Simon, creator of The Wire, and is directed by Paul Haggis
item.body:
“Don’t tell anybody, but I always wanted to be the mayor…”

Oscar Isaac plays Nick Wasicsko, a real-life 1970s mayor in Yonkers, New York, in this new six-part miniseries from David Simon. Directed by Paul Haggis (Crash), it also stars Catherine Keener, Alfred Molina, Bob Balaban, Peter Riegert, LaTanya Richardson Jackson, Carla Quevedo, Jon Bernthal (The Walking Dead), Winona Ryder, James Belushi and Clarke Peters (Lester Freamon on The Wire).

Show Me a Hero debuts on Sunday, 16 August, on HBO in the US, and mid-August on Sky Atlantic in the UK
